revised_title: Improved Compressive Stress-Strain Measurements at High Strain Rates
tldr: This article presents an improved method for measuring compressive stress-strain at very high strain rates using the split Hopkinson pressure bar. The authors describe modifications to the technique, allowing accurate measurements on high-strength metals and alloys at strain rates up to about 10^3 s^-1. They also discuss the accuracy of the technique and assess errors arising from nonlinearity in the instrumentation, dispersion, frictional restraint, and inertia.
